t: Matthew 11
John the Baptist Doubts
When*p Jesus had finished giving instructions to his twelve disciples, he moved on from there to teach and preach in their towns.
Now when John heard in prison what the Christ was doing, he sent a message through his disciples
and asked him, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we expect someone else?”
Jesus*p replied to them, “Go*r and*r report*r to*r John*r what*r you*r hear*r and*r see:*r

The*r blind*r receive*r their*r sight,*r the*r lame*r walk,*r those*r with*r leprosy*r are*r cleansed,*r the*r deaf*r hear,*r the*r dead*r are*r raised,*r and*r the*r poor*r are*r told*r the*r good*r news,*r
and*r blessed*r is*r the*r one*r who*r isn’t*r offended*r by*r me.”*r
As*p these men were leaving, Jesus began to speak to the crowds about John: “What*r did*r you*r go*r out*r into*r the*r wilderness*r to*r see?*r A*r reed*r swaying*r in*r the*r wind?*r

What*r then*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r prophet?*r Yes,*r I*r tell*r you,*r and*r more*r than*r a*r prophet.*r
This*r is*r the*r one*r about*r whom*r it*r is*r written:*r See,*irpn I*ir am*ir sending*ir my*ir messenger*ir ahead*ir of*ir you;*ir he*irln will*ir prepare*ir your*ir way*ir before*ir you.*ir

“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,*r among*r those*r born*r of*r women*r no*r one*r greater*r than*r John*r the*r Baptist*r has*r appeared,*r but*r the*r least*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r greater*r than*r he.*r
From*r the*r days*r of*r John*r the*r Baptist*r until*r now,*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r has*r been*r suffering*r violence,*r and*r the*r violent*r have*r been*r seizing*r it*r by*r force.*r
For*r all*r the*r prophets*r and*r the*r law*r prophesied*r until*r John.*r

An Unresponsive Generation
“To*rp what*r should*r I*r compare*r this*r generation?*r It’s*r like*r children*r sitting*r in*r the*r marketplaces*r who*r call*r out*r to*r other*r children:*r
We*rpn played*r the*r flute*r for*r you,*r but*rln you*r didn’t*r dance;*r we*rln sang*r a*r lament,*r but*rln you*r didn’t*r mourn!*r

Then*p he proceeded to denounce the towns where most of his miracles were done, because they did not repent:

The Son Gives Knowledge and Rest

At*p that time Jesus said, “I*r praise*r you,*r Father,*r Lord*r of*r heaven*r and*r earth,*r because*r you*r have*r hidden*r these*r things*r from*r the*r wise*r and*r intelligent*r and*r revealed*r them*r to*r infants.*r
